title: Feasibility Trial Assessing Adherence and Response to a Ketogenic Dietary Intervention for Individuals at High Risk for Alzheimer's Disease
description_brief: The intervention program proof-of-concept was assessed as a single-arm, within-subjects clinical study with a target enrollment of 10 participants with possible or probable amnestic MCI. The protocol required participants to complete a pre-intervention assessment within two weeks of beginning the intervention, attend seven, one-hour intervention group sessions across six weeks, complete a post-assessment and interview in the final week of the intervention, and complete weekly surveys throughout the intervention.
description_detailed:
The primary goal of the proof-of-concept phase is to use pre-post comparisons to determine if the treatment package can produce clinically significant improvements. Thus, our goal was to assess whether the MI-CBT KNA program influenced adherence to KN and cognitive outcomes. Of note, recruitment for the trial occurred in the weeks leading up to the COVID-19 pandemic, which substantially altered the original intervention and assessment design due to restrictions on in-person human subject research. While the original protocol included in-person assessments and group meetings, collection of multiple biological samples (i.e., lipid panels, basic vitals, inflammatory biomarkers), and weekly health assessments, these in-person components were modified or removed for completion during the COVID-19 pandemic. Pre-assessment and screening appointments described below were completed in-person prior to the COVID-19 pandemic. Thus, we completed pre-intervention neuropsychological assessments with participants at baseline prior to beginning the trial; however, immediately following baseline assessments, we fully revised the protocol to include only online, video, and phone contact. We moved the KNA program to an online platform (HIPAA-compliant Zoom), and assessments were changed to online surveys and video assessments. Individual testing of the video platform was completed prior to the trial, which successfully reduced technical problems.

The MI-CBT KNA Program proof-of-concept was assessed as a single-arm, within-subjects clinical study with a target enrollment of 10 participants with possible or probable amnestic MCI. The protocol required participants to complete a pre-intervention assessment within two weeks of beginning the intervention, attend seven, one-hour intervention group sessions across six weeks, complete a post-assessment and interview in the final week of the intervention, and complete weekly surveys throughout the intervention. Participants were mailed materials, including the participant workbook and food, macronutrient, and ketone logs. Participants were also sent two bottles of ketone urine test strips for daily testing and materials to complete follow-up assessments. Throughout the program, participants were instructed to titrate into full ketosis across the first four weeks of the program by gradually reducing total carbohydrate intake and increasing healthy fat intake (e.g., fish, nuts, avocado, olive oils etc.). Thus, participants were not expected to attain measurable ketone levels until the final weeks of the program.

groups.title: MI-CBT KNA Program
groups.description:
6-week group intervention using MI and CBT strategies to promote adherence to a ketogenic nutrition program.

Motivational Interviewing-Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Ketogenic Nutrition Adherence Program: The intervention using strategies from motivational interviewing and cognitive behavioral therapy to promote motivation and adherence to ketogenic nutrition in older adults at high risk for Alzheimer's disease. The program is a 6-week, group program led by a psychologist and nutrition expert.

groups.title: MI-CBT KNA Program

The program is a 6-week, group program led by a psychologist and nutrition expert.

measures.title: Repeatable Battery for Assessment of Neuropsychological Status (RBANS-Update)
measures.description: Repeatable Battery for Assessment of Neuropsychological Status (RBANS-Update) Total Scaled Score. Scores are normed based on age, and 100 is considered average (50th percentile). Higher scores are associated with better cognitive functioning.

measures.title: Adherence
measures.description: Participants self-rated their adherence to the diet on a 1-10 scale, with higher scores corresponding to better adherence.

outcomeMeasures.title: Ketogenic Adherence
outcomeMeasures.description: Assessed based on reported ketone levels during the program (reporting at least one day or greater with trace amounts of ketones) using urinalysis ketone test strips administered at home by participants.

groups.title: MI-CBT KNA Program
groups.description:
6-week group intervention using MI and CBT strategies to promote adherence to a ketogenic nutrition program.

Motivational Interviewing-Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Ketogenic Nutrition Adherence Program: The intervention using strategies from motivational interviewing and cognitive behavioral therapy to promote motivation and adherence to ketogenic nutrition in older adults at high risk for Alzheimer's disease. The program is a 6-week, group program led by a psychologist and nutrition expert.

outcomeMeasures.title: Acceptability
outcomeMeasures.description:
Assessed based on qualitative feedback and online surveys described here: https://pilotfeasibilitystudies.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s40814-022-00970-z.

Participants also rated how well they felt the program helped them achieve their health-related goals 0 (none) to 3 (all).

groups.title: MI-CBT KNA Program

Motivational Interviewing-Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Ketogenic Nutrition Adherence Program: The intervention using strategies from motivational interviewing and cognitive behavioral therapy to promote motivation and adherence to ketogenic nutrition in older adults at high risk for Alzheimer's disease. The program is a 6-week, group program led by a psychologist and nutrition expert.

outcomeMeasures.title: Retention
outcomeMeasures.description: Assessed based on attendance and % of participants who remained in the program from start to finish

groups.title: MI-CBT KNA Program
groups.description:
6-week group intervention using MI and CBT strategies to promote adherence to a ketogenic nutrition program.

Motivational Interviewing-Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Ketogenic Nutrition Adherence Program: The intervention using strategies from motivational interviewing and cognitive behavioral therapy to promote motivation and adherence to ketogenic nutrition in older adults at high risk for Alzheimer's disease. The program is a 6-week, group program led by a psychologist and nutrition expert.

outcomeMeasures.title: Cognitive Functioning
outcomeMeasures.description: Assessed using the total scaled score (age-normed) of the Repeatable Battery for the Assessment of Neuropsychological Status - Update. A score of 100 is considered "average" (50th percentile), and higher scores are considered better cognitive functioning. The outcome reported is the actual value at 6-weeks, rather than a change score.

explanation_target: Reason: The study title and description describe a ketogenic dietary intervention (a behavioral/nutritional program) delivered as a feasibility, single-arm within-subjects study in people with possible/probable amnestic MCI. This is a non‑pharmacologic, dietary intervention — not a biologic (e.g., monoclonal antibody), not a small‑molecule drug, and not an investigational cognitive‑enhancing drug or an agent aimed specifically at neuropsychiatric symptoms. citeturn0search0turn0search8

Act: Extracted key details from the description — intervention: ketogenic nutrition/adherence program (group sessions, ketone monitoring); population: possible/probable amnestic MCI (high risk for AD); design: single‑arm feasibility/proof‑of‑concept with pre/post assessments and weekly surveys. Because the intervention is a diet (nutritional/behavioral), there is no drug name to lookup. The published feasibility reports of similar ketogenic adherence programs confirm this classification. citeturn0search0turn0search8

Reflect: Classification decision — 'N/A'. The provided category definitions focus on drug classes (biologic vs small molecule) or pharmacologic intent (cognitive enhancer, neuropsychiatric symptom improvement). A dietary ketogenic intervention does not fit those four drug‑focused categories even though the trial aims to improve cognition; therefore per the instructions it should be classified as 'N/A'. Prior ketogenic diet trials in MCI/AD have sought cognitive benefit but remain nutritional interventions rather than drugs. citeturn0search2turn0search3
Web search results (selected) supporting the above:

- Feasibility of an MI‑CBT ketogenic adherence program for older adults with mild cognitive impairment (pilot feasibility article describing a similar single‑arm ketogenic adherence program; trial NCT04968041). citeturn0search0
- Feasibility of an MI‑CBT ketogenic adherence program — full description and aims (Pilot and Feasibility Studies). citeturn0search8
- Randomized crossover trial of a modified ketogenic diet in Alzheimer's disease (examples of ketogenic diet trials targeting cognition/daily function in AD). citeturn0search2
- Ketogenic diet feasibility and efficacy data in AD (additional pilot data showing ketogenic diet used as an intervention to assess cognitive effects). citeturn0search3
